get.description: Lists the autoscale settings for a subscription

200.description: Successful request for a list of autoscale settings

schema.description: Represents a collection of autoscale setting resources.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

value.description: the values for the autoscale setting resources.

type.description: Azure resource type

properties.description: The autoscale setting of the resource.

enabled.description: the enabled flag. Specifies whether automatic scaling is enabled for the resource. The default value is 'true'.

name.description: the name of the autoscale setting.

customEmails.description: the custom e-mails list. This value can be null or empty, in which case this attribute will be ignored.

sendToSubscriptionAdministrator.description: a value indicating whether to send email to subscription administrator.

sendToSubscriptionCoAdministrators.description: a value indicating whether to send email to subscription co-administrators.

operation.description: the operation associated with the notification and its value must be "scale"

items.description: Webhook notification of an autoscale event.

properties.description: a property bag of settings. This value can be empty.

serviceUri.description: the service address to receive the notification.

profiles.description: the collection of automatic scaling profiles that specify different scaling parameters for different time periods. A maximum of 20 profiles can be specified.

capacity.description: the number of instances that can be used during this profile.

default.description: the number of instances that will be set if metrics are not available for evaluation. The default is only used if the current instance count is lower than the default.

maximum.description: the maximum number of instances for the resource. The actual maximum number of instances is limited by the cores that are available in the subscription.

minimum.description: the minimum number of instances for the resource.

fixedDate.description: the specific date-time for the profile. This element is not used if the Recurrence element is used.

end.description: the end time for the profile in ISO 8601 format.

start.description: the start time for the profile in ISO 8601 format.

timeZone.description: the timezone of the start and end times for the profile. recurrence.description: the repeating times at which this profile begins. This element is not used if the FixedDate element is used.

frequency.description: the recurrence frequency. How often the schedule profile should take effect. This value must be Week, meaning each week will have the same set of profiles. For example, to set a daily schedule, set **schedule** to every day of the week. The frequency property specifies that the schedule is repeated weekly.

schedule.description: the scheduling constraints for when the profile begins.

days.description: the collection of days that the profile takes effect on. Possible values are Sunday through Saturday.

hours.description: A collection of hours that the profile takes effect on. Values supported are 0 to 23 on the 24-hour clock (AM/PM times are not supported).

minutes.description: A collection of minutes at which the profile takes effect at.

timeZone.description: the timezone for the hours of the profile. rules.description: the collection of rules that provide the triggers and parameters for the scaling action. A maximum of 10 rules can be specified.

items.description: A rule that provide the triggers and parameters for the scaling action.

metricTrigger.description: the trigger that results in a scaling action.

metricName.description: the name of the metric that defines what the rule monitors.

metricResourceUri.description: the resource identifier of the resource the rule monitors.

operator.description: the operator that is used to compare the metric data and the threshold.

statistic.description: the metric statistic type. How the metrics from multiple instances are combined.

threshold.description: the threshold of the metric that triggers the scale action.

timeAggregation.description: time aggregation type. How the data that is collected should be combined over time. The default value is Average.

timeGrain.description: the granularity of metrics the rule monitors. Must be one of the predefined values returned from metric definitions for the metric. Must be between 12 hours and 1 minute.

timeWindow.description: the range of time in which instance data is collected. This value must be greater than the delay in metric collection, which can vary from resource-to-resource. Must be between 12 hours and 5 minutes.

scaleAction.description: the parameters for the scaling action.

cooldown.description: the amount of time to wait since the last scaling action before this action occurs. It must be between 1 week and 1 minute in ISO 8601 format.

direction.description: the scale direction. Whether the scaling action increases or decreases the number of instances.

type.description: the type of action that should occur when the scale rule fires.

value.description: the number of instances that are involved in the scaling action. This value must be 1 or greater. The default value is 1.

targetResourceUri.description: the resource identifier of the resource that the autoscale setting should be added to.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

schema.description: Describes the format of Error response.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

rules.description: the collection of rules that provide the triggers and parameters for the scaling action. A maximum of 10 rules can be specified.

items.description: A rule that provide the triggers and parameters for the scaling action.

metricTrigger.description: the trigger that results in a scaling action.

metricName.description: the name of the metric that defines what the rule monitors.

metricResourceUri.description: the resource identifier of the resource the rule monitors.

operator.description: the operator that is used to compare the metric data and the threshold.

statistic.description: the metric statistic type. How the metrics from multiple instances are combined.

threshold.description: the threshold of the metric that triggers the scale action.

timeAggregation.description: time aggregation type. How the data that is collected should be combined over time. The default value is Average.

timeGrain.description: the granularity of metrics the rule monitors. Must be one of the predefined values returned from metric definitions for the metric. Must be between 12 hours and 1 minute.

timeWindow.description: the range of time in which instance data is collected. This value must be greater than the delay in metric collection, which can vary from resource-to-resource. Must be between 12 hours and 5 minutes.

scaleAction.description: the parameters for the scaling action.

cooldown.description: the amount of time to wait since the last scaling action before this action occurs. It must be between 1 week and 1 minute in ISO 8601 format.

direction.description: the scale direction. Whether the scaling action increases or decreases the number of instances.

type.description: the type of action that should occur when the scale rule fires.

value.description: the number of instances that are involved in the scaling action. This value must be 1 or greater. The default value is 1.

targetResourceUri.description: the resource identifier of the resource that the autoscale setting should be added to.
